Data Structures | Macros
System Devices
Stratify OS » Device Interface
Collaboration diagram for System Devices:

Detailed Description

This driver provides details about the currently installed operating system.

Data Structures

Macros

#define SYS_DEVICE
 This defines the configuration values for the system device (/dev/sys) device in the device table.

 This defines the configuration values for the null device (/dev/null) device in the device table.

 This defines the configuration values for the null device (/dev/null) device in the device table.

 This defines the configuration values for the full device (/dev/full) device in the device table.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_LED_SET

This sets the state of the specified LED.

Example:

1 #include <unistd.h>
2 #include <dev/sys.h>
3 ...
4 led_req_t req;
5 req.channel = 0;
6 req.on = 1;
7 ioctl(led_fd, I_LED_SET, &req); //turns LED on channel 1 on
#define I_SYS_GETATTR

This request applies the software write protect to the entire device.

Example:

1 #include <dev/sys.h>
2 #include <uinstd.h>
3 #include <stdio.h>
4 ...
5 sys_attr_t attr;
6 ioctl(fildes, I_SYS_GETATTR, &attr);
7 printf("Version is %s\n", attr.version);
#define I_SYS_GETPROCESS

This requests checks to see if the named process is currently running.

1 sys_process_t p;
2 strcpy(p.name, "hello");
3 ioctl(fd, I_SYS_ISRUNNING, &p);
4 if( p.pid < 0 ){
5  //process is not running
6 }
#define I_SYS_GETTASK

This request gets the information about the specified task.

1 sys_task_t task;
2 task.tid = 1;
3 ioctl(fd, I_SYS_GETTASK, &task);
#define I_SYS_KILL

This request sends a signal to all the tasks in the specified process group.

#define I_SYS_PTHREADKILL

This request sends a signal to a single task (thread)

#define I_SYS_SUDO

This request temporarily changes the effective user ID to root. As root certain system functions are available that would not available to the user. For example, as root, an application can set an interrupt callback that is executed in privileged mode.

1 sys_sudo_t passwd;
2 strcpy(passwd.key, "the password");
3 if( ioctl(fd, I_SYS_SUDO, &passwd) < 0 ){
4  //failed to accept password
5 }
#define LED_DEVICE (   dev_name,
  active_level,
  pio_port0,
  pio_pin0,
  pio_port1,
  pio_pin1,
  pio_port2,
  pio_pin2,
  pio_port3,
  pio_pin3 
)

This defines the configuration values for an LED device that can drive up to 4 LEDs.

Parameters
dev_nameThe name of the led device
active_levelLED_ACTIVE_LOW or LED_ACTIVE_HIGH
pio_port0The port for channel 0
pio_pin0The pin for channel 0
pio_port1The port for channel 1 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin1The pin for channel 1 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_port2The port for channel 2 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin2The pin for channel 2 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_port3The port for channel 3 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
pio_pin3The pin for channel 3 (use LED_DEVICE_UNUSED if not used)
#define SDSPI_DEVICE (   device_name,
  port_number,
  pin_assign_value,
  cs_port_value,
  cs_pin_value,
  bitrate_value,
  cfg_ptr,
  state_ptr,
  mode_value,
  uid_value,
  gid_value 
)

This defines the configuration values for a SD SPI device in the device table.

Parameters
device_nameThe name of the device (e.g "disk0")
port_numberThe SPI peripheral port number
pin_assign_valueThe GPIO configuration to use with the SPI bus
cs_port_valueThe GPIO port used for the chip select
cs_pin_valueThe GPIO pin used for the chip select
bitrate_valueThe maximum allowable bitrate for the SST25VF
cfg_ptrA pointer to the configuration structure (const sst25vf_cfg_t *)
state_ptrA pointer to the state structure (sst25vf_state_t *)
mode_valueThe access mode (usually 0666)
uid_valueThe User ID
gid_valueThe Group ID
